No, no, look at the beginning section of SUKASHI TSUBA by Sasano.  You'll find "quiet strength" referred to there.

David 
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Barry Thomas 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, July 22, 2005 5:40 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba school - WABI SABI


  David asked:

  > Do you know which are the Japanese terms for the
  > "rustic quality" and "quiet strength" so many tsuba
  > vendors claim every tsuba has got, btw?

  No I don't, but I guess "rustic quality" would have to interpreted as "wabi
  sabi" and "quiet strength" I feel is an expression some Western writer has used
  somewhere that has flowed into general usage...

  I'm sure there are others far better qualified to answer this.

  One might also observe that when a currency is debased the terms really mean
  nothing and once again we are on our own...

  Barry.
